Using â€œstringsâ€ on the executable returns a fake flag and the messages that we will see when executing the program. The program first asks for a password. Using â€œSup3rS3cr3tP455W0rdâ€ as found through â€œstringsâ€, grants us access to the next stage, where we are asked to provide a code. This stage can not be completed through the previously mentioned method and so we need to open the program in a disassembler. The code is minimally obfuscated and we can see that the variable that was initialized with the scanf call is compared against â€œ0x539â€ or â€œ1337â€ in decimal. Passing â€œ1337â€ to the program as the secret code gives us the flag.
